instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: I get a little pulse after applying power but then it goes to 0V. This board was working and then stopped booting. I know this was a liquid spill, but I don't see any signs of damage. Any idea what would cause those two pins to lose power? Area around <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> looks good. I've checked continuity and resistors around and leading into the area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Is this the same board????  [url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/13479-measuring-dead-short-on-cpu-vcore-on-an-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-any-hope[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Ha, no, dead short on the CPU is not going to get me too far. No, this is just one of the many Air boards in the queue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: CPU Vcore pulse too? Check pin 8 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is measuring a steady 1.8V. Pin 8 on <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> looks good and is measuring 3.4V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: So all power is present I take. USB mouse lighting up?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Yes, USB mouse is lighting up. This was booting, passed testing and was on it's way out when it failed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: If USB mouse lights the board is usually alive. Check if you have an image without backlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: I get much more than that. It actually starts to boot and then moves very slowly once the progress bar gets close to the end. It never actually finishes booting, just hangs in that state of almost-booting.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Everything is connected? Bettery, touchpad, etc....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Yeah, with trackpad. And attempted with and without battery. Same result.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Power on and hold "D" key and report error codes....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Good thought, unfortunately that gives me no errors. It's not seeing the problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: I thought this thing wasn't even booting. Did you boot of a known good USB drive? PRAM reset? Was the SPI chip ever messed with?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Yeah, good USB test drive. Used it to boot up on another computer right after this just to make sure. SPI chip wasn't messed with. Not much was done to the board. It's been a while but I think it was an ultrasonic-only fix. I can't see where I did any work on it. And I can't see any sign of a spill, but I know it was a spill. PRAM reset didn't change anything.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: When you boot up with "D" pressed does it actually run the onboard diagnostics and report it is all ok?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: Yes, I just ran it again with everything plugged in. Online of Offline, it says No Issues Found Reference Code ADP000.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Not booting completely. No power on pins 5 and 6 of SPI ROM
threads.message: I have no idea about this one. Could be corrosion anywhere. Usually boot issues like this are corrosion around CPU power supply or SMC.
